channel.title: The Sydney Morning Herald National Headlines
channel.description: The top National headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit http://www.smh.com.au.

item.title: Making all the difference
item.description: We live in a wealthy society and yet too few of us who are well off willingly share our time and money. Nic Bolto hopes to persuade people that it's worth it.

item.title: Backpacking bartenders call for visa extension
item.description: SHE came for cash to keep travelling, and found herself in a country pub where patrons arrive with pet snakes and locals clamour for a drink, and a gawk, when a new barmaid is in town.

item.title: Greens push for extra $300m to assist small-business owners
item.description: SMALL-business owners would receive extra support worth up to $300 million a year, to be funded by cuts to mining tax breaks, under a new proposal from the Greens.

item.title: GST will become crutch for ageing nation, says Henry
item.description: THE federal government will have to rely more on taxes on spending such as the GST to meet growing revenue needs as the population ages, the former Treasury secretary Ken Henry said yesterday.

item.title: A mother's instincts led to quest for the truth behind daughter's death
item.description: WHEN Sharon Forbes was told her daughter Laura had died from a suspected drug overdose, she immediately sensed something was not right.

item.title: AEC comes under fire over selection of party donors facing review
item.description: THE country's electoral commission has been grilled by Liberal MPs on why it has reviewed the donations of only one Labor-affiliated union since 2007.

item.title: Milk to be permeate-free: food chains
item.description: Woolworths and Coles say their private-label milk will become free of permeate, a watery waste product from the production of cheese.

item.title: Chicken feed: Ingham stands to make $1.6b from selling the family farm
item.description: THE billionaire chicken farmer and racehorse breeder Bob Ingham has decided he will no longer rule the roost at the company that bears his name.

item.title: Indonesia lashes Coalition over asylum policy
item.description: THE Indonesian Foreign Minister, Marty Natalegawa, has directly repudiated comments by the opposition last week that the relationship between his country and Australia was dysfunctional because of the asylum seeker issue.

item.title: Lawyers call for $330m to bridge legal aid gap
item.description: COMMUNITY lawyers are calling for a doubling of federal spending on legal assistance services to help the estimated half a million Australians who miss out on legal help each year.

item.title: Supercomputer mimics common cold in search for way to treat it
item.description: AUSTRALIAN scientists have used a new supercomputer to simulate the movement of the virus that causes the common cold for the first time.

item.title: Police identify Kelly's killer: report
item.description: Police have reportedly identified a suspect in the death of Thomas Kelly, who was fatally king hit on his first night out in Sydney's Kings Cross.

item.title: Full transcript: Nic Bolto
item.description: Michael Short talks to Nick Bolto, founder and editor of The DIfference, in The Zone.

item.title: Leaders need to be popular: Fitzgibbon
item.description: Gillard government whip Joel Fitzgibbon has again fuelled Labor leadership speculation by pointedly noting that populism matters in politics.

item.title: Asylum seeker boat approached oil platform
item.description: Australian authorities have gone to the aid of another boat carrying asylum seekers after it approached an oil and gas platform.

item.title: Global economic risks loom large: IMF
item.description: The IMF says prompt policy action is needed to counter the downside risks to the global economy.

item.title: Souths pip Roosters 24-22 in NRL miracle
item.description: Two tries in as many minutes have delivered South Sydney a thrilling 24-22 NRL victory over bitter rivals Sydney Roosters.

item.title: Dragons lose Stanley for NRL season
item.description: St George Illawarra utility Kyle Stanley's NRL season is over after it was confirmed he would require a full knee reconstruction.

item.title: Judd's fate rests with AFL Tribunal
item.description: Carlton captain Chris Judd must front the AFL Tribunal on Tuesday night, for a chicken wing tackle which the match review panel has called unsportsmanlike.

item.title: Quade Cooper to miss Super play-off
item.description: The Queensland Reds have suffered a major jolt to their Super Rugby title defence with star playmaker Quade Cooper suspended for one game.

item.title: Qld minister's daughter charged over drug
item.description: The daughter of a Queensland government minister has been charged with possessing an illegal drug.

item.title: WA govt ready to reassess shark protection
item.description: The commonwealth says it will help the WA government to reassess the protected status of the great white shark following the latest fatal attack.

item.title: Eagles to learn from Sydney hiding
item.description: West Coast learned some important lessons from their heavy AFL loss to Sydney, and will aim to turn around their fortunes against Adelaide on Saturday.

item.title: Broncos hit by new injury blow
item.description: Brisbane have been hit with a backline injury crisis with winger Dale Copley ruled out for up to six weeks with a fractured fibula.

item.title: Missing girl may have been raped: inquest
item.description: A young Sydney girl said she has terrible secrets before she went missing 22 years ago, an inquest into her death has heard.

item.title: Man told child he would rape her: court
item.description: A Sydney paint salesman accused of grabbing two young girls and threatening to rape one at knifepoint has been linked to DNA found on their clothing.

item.title: Port furious over Cats' Boak approach
item.description: Geelong's visit to South Australia to speak to sought-after Travis Boak has angered his AFL club Port Adelaide.

item.title: Bailey heads back to Tassie for BBL
item.description: Australia Twenty20 captain George Bailey will return to Tasmania to play for Hobart in this summer's domestic T20 competition.

item.title: Henry seeks better explanation of taxes
item.description: Former treasury boss Ken Henry says tax changes and their objectives must be better explained to the community if they are to succeed.

item.title: Moltzen happy to seal Tigers NRL deal
item.description: Tim Moltzen says he's relieved to have his future sorted after he agreed to a new three-year contract with West Tigers.

item.title: Fair Work officer defends Thomson report
item.description: Fair Work Australia investigator Terry Nassios has appeared at a parliamentary hearing to defend his report on Craig Thomson and the HSU.

item.title: Woodside gets EPA green light for Browse
item.description: Western Australia's environmental watchdog has given the ok to Woodside's $30 billion Browse gas project, but only if it meets 29 strict conditions.

item.title: Seven wants NRL if price is right
item.description: Seven is still interested in screening NRL games but says it will not pay excessive amounts for the privilege.

item.title: Voss wants harder edge from AFL Lions
item.description: Brisbane coach Michael Voss has called on his team to ditch their nice-guy status and bring a harder edge to their AFL derby against Gold Coast.

item.title: Ex-NRL star Craig Field on murder charge
item.description: Former South Sydney rugby league captain Craig Field has not applied for bail after he was charged with murdering a man outside a NSW pub.

item.title: Oppn boat policy exposed as a sham: PM
item.description: Prime Minister Julia Gillard says the opposition's asylum-seeker policies have been exposed as a "sham" and a "pantomime".

item.title: Judd must face AFL Tribunal over tackle
item.description: Carlton captain Chris Judd has been ordered to face the AFL Tribunal on Tuesday night over his chicken wing tackle on North Melbourne's Leigh Adams.

item.title: Longmire praises Canadian AFL convert
item.description: The progress of Sydney's Canadian ruckman Mike Pyke has been hailed by Swans AFL coach John Longmire.

item.title: Atkinson extends Asia-Pacific rally lead
item.description: Australia's Chris Atkinson has closed in on the FIA Asia Pacific Rally Championship after extending his lead with a 2nd place finish in Malaysia.

item.title: PM targets IR reform as key election issue
item.description: Prime Minister Julia Gillard says workplace reform will be a key election battleground, as small business calls for a fairer deal.

item.title: Sydney FC call for more A-League games
item.description: Sydney FC coach Ian Crook and playmaker Nicky Carle believe a 36-game A-League season could be a solution to such a lengthy break.

item.title: Ferguson over the moon at ODI recall
item.description: Batsman Callum Ferguson says he's ready to return to his best after earning a surprise recall to Australia's one-day side.

item.title: Kasiano hit with NRL high shot charge
item.description: Canterbury prop Sam Kasiano has been hit with a grade two high tackle charge for his challenge on Parramatta's Fuifui Moimoi last Friday.

item.title: Barrister's wife buried head first: court
item.description: The trial of prominent barrister Lloyd Rayney, accused of wilfully murdering his wife, has opened in Western Australia's Supreme Court.

item.title: Researchers closer to understanding the common cold
item.description: Melbourne scientists have used a new supercomputer to simulate the movement of the virus that causes the common cold for the first time.

item.title: Freo's Anthony Morabito injured again
item.description: Anthony Morabito will visit a specialist later this week to determine whether he can play again in 2012 after re-injuring his reconstructed left knee.

item.title: Jeffrey Gilham's uncle dies 'burnt out'
item.description: Jeffrey Gilham's uncle, who never accepted that his nephew was not guilty of killing three family members, has died at a Sydney home.

item.title: Lego man
item.description: To mark the 50th anniversary of Lego in Australia, Mark Curnow shows us his collection of bricks.

item.title: Personal finance up 0.4% in May=2
item.description: Total personal finance rose by 0.4 per cent in May.

item.title: Ingham's up for sale
item.description: Poultry producer Ingham's Enterprises is up for sale.

item.title: Bombers' Howlett wary of cut Cats
item.description: Essendon's Ben Howlett hopes the Bombers can repeat their heroics from last AFL season against premiers Geelong when they play on Friday night.

item.title: Interim court order to end Coles blockade
item.description: A Victorian judge has granted an interim order prohibiting striking workers from blocking delivery trucks at a Coles warehouse in Melbourne's north.

item.title: Sharks hit by Lambie loss for Super final
item.description: The Sharks have been forced to rule out three starting players for Saturday night's Super Rugby play-off against Queensland in Brisbane.

item.title: Bulldog Wright backing Barba for Dally M
item.description: Canterbury winger Jonathan Wright expects teammate Ben Barba to take out this year's Dally M Medal after another dazzling NRL display at the weekend.

item.title: Deans says Wallabies in the deep end
item.description: Wallabies coach Robbie Deans says Australia have been thrown in the deep end of the new Rugby Championship, with their first two games against New Zealand.

item.title: Whitehaven shares up 18.5%
item.description: Whitehaven shares have risen by 18.5 per cent in early trading on Monday following a takeover offer by Nathan Tinkler

item.title: Kiesha's mother to stand trial for murder
item.description: A NSW magistrate has called for an end to public displays of animosity towards Kristi Anne Abrahams as she faces a trial for the murder of her daughter Kiesha.

item.title: Turning boats back works: Sri Lankan envoy
item.description: Asylum seekers will be forced to look for other ways of getting to Australia if their boats are turned back to Sri Lanka, the country's high commissioner says.

item.title: Seven West prepares for capital raising
item.description: Kerry Stokes' Seven West Media has placed its shares in a trading halt, pending the announcement of a capital raising.

item.title: Productivity is up to everyone: Swan
item.description: Productivity is an economy-wide issue that should be tackled by everyone not just government, Treasurer Wayne Swan says.

item.title: Bonds still weaker after Chinese data
item.description: The Australian bond market continues to weaken after the release of strong Chinese economic growth figures last week.

item.title: Stocks to watch at close on Monday
item.description: Stocks of interest on the Australian Securities Exchange at close on Monday

item.title: Commodities markets summary
item.description: Commodities news from around the world

item.title: International markets roundup
item.description: News from the world’s major stock markets

item.title: Josh Ritter plays 'Folk Bloodbath'
item.description: US singer-songwriter Josh Ritter chats with Martin Boulton and performs Folk Bloodbath.

item.title: Aust shares close higher
item.description: The Australian share market closed higher on Monday as investors felt more prepared to take on risk following positive Chinese data last week.

item.title: Better mobile reception for Sydney trains
item.description: Mobile phone customers will get reception in some Sydney train tunnels from this week - and it's only taken 16 years for the work to be completed.

item.title: $A higher as commodity prices rise
item.description: The Australian dollar is higher getting a boost from rising commodity prices and relief that the Chinese economic growth is not slowing too much.

item.title: Sci-fi tech coming to a classroom near you
item.description: Touch-screen tables, robot study buddies and 3D virtual learning environments could soon feature in the classroom.

item.title: Sri Lankans reach Christmas Island
item.description: A boat carrying 51 Sri Lankan asylum seekers has arrived at Christmas Island, with the group now expected to have their initial claims for asylum processed there.

item.title: Spirited chaplain aims to keep athletes on track
item.description: WITH more than 10,000 athletes competing at the Olympics and fewer than 10 per cent able to win a medal, the event always brings ''emotional upset and trauma'', says Australia's Olympic chaplain, Nett Knox.

item.title: Hicks's military lawyer dons civvies for Australian law firm
item.description: IN A personal reinvention, the US military lawyer who represented the Guantanamo Bay detainee David Hicks has come to Australia to work as a civilian lawyer.

item.title: Local cafes embrace cordial living with home brews
item.description: IN SOME of Sydney's cafes and restaurants, diners who ask for a bottle of Coke receive a polite but firm refusal.

item.title: Medical care short of best practice: study
item.description: THE first widescale audit of Australian healthcare has found 43 per cent of people are missing out on care in line with best practice or the latest medical advice.

item.title: No longer a case of curse and be damned at work
item.description: WHEN security guard Craig Symes told his manager to ''get f---ed'' his employers felt they had strong grounds to sack him.

item.title: Priest helped by his police friend to bring charges against boy
item.description: AN ARMIDALE priest suspected of child abuse was assisted by a ''mate'' who was a policeman to bring blackmail charges against one his former altar boy victims, court transcripts reveal.

item.title: Medical study reveals some unhealthy results
item.description: The first wide-scale audit of Australian healthcare has found 43 per cent of people are missing out on care in line with best practice or the latest medical advice.

item.title: PM picks her battle: election focus on jobs
item.description: JULIA GILLARD has pushed industrial relations to the forefront as she seeks to define the next election as being about jobs, the economy and the workplace, and not just the carbon tax.

item.title: Queen of the waves is still cresting
item.description: WHEN Stephanie Gilmore won her first world surfing title at age 19, she declared she wanted to win 10. Five years on, the 24-year-old is halfway there after claiming the 2012 Association of Surfing Professionals crown in Biarritz, France, at the weekend.

item.title: Fears over Afghan army, Taliban collusion
item.description: A TALIBAN fighter hiding in a tree is believed to have shot special forces Sergeant Blaine Diddams in an act that has raised fears Afghan soldiers have been collaborating with insurgents.

item.title: Swearing starts a new discussion
item.description: When security guard Craig Symes told his manager to ''get f---ed'' his employers felt they had strong grounds to sack him.

item.title: Asylum seeker boat rescued by commercial ship
item.description: A commercial ship has come to the aid of an ailing boat carrying 27 asylum seekers off the Cocos Islands.

item.title: Guantanamo lawyer Mori moves to Australia
item.description: The US military lawyer who defended Guantanamo detainee David Hicks has moved to Australia and is starting a new job in Melbourne.

item.title: Swans go top as Hawks and Crows fire
item.description: Sydney are top of the AFL ladder, but Adelaide and Hawthorn have also leapt into the top four with big wins in their matches on Sunday.

item.title: Sironen finds voice with Tigers
item.description: Wests Tigers rookie Curtis Sironen says he has to demand the ball more if he wants to make an impact at the NRL level.

item.title: Swans continue winning streak over Eagles
item.description: Sydney's Lewis Jetta has booted four goals to help his side remain at the top of the AFL ladder with a 52-point thrashing of West Coast.

item.title: Flanagan furious over NRL refs calls
item.description: Cronulla coach Shane Flanagan was left fuming after two crucial calls went against his side in Sunday's 18-10 loss to St George Illawarra.

item.title: Hawks surge into AFL top four
item.description: Hawthorn have outscored Western Bulldogs nine goals to one in the second half to score a 72-point win in their round 16 AFL clash.

item.title: PM skips Greens talk at NSW ALP conference
item.description: Greens leader Christine Milne has praised Prime Minister Julia Gillard for not denouncing her party at the NSW Labor conference.

item.title: Carbon price won't work on its own: report
item.description: The Grattan Institute believes the carbon price is "inherently uncertain" because it isn't fixed and relies on the decisions of governments.

item.title: Brumbies' Super fairytale unravels
item.description: The Brumbies are shattered after their fairytale Super Rugby story crumbled in 14 heart-breaking hours on the weekend.

item.title: Dragons slay critics with win over Sharks
item.description: St George Illawarra coach Steve Price claims his side silenced their critics with their 18-10 NRL win over Cronulla at WIN Stadium on Sunday.

item.title: Judd tackle could go straight to tribunal
item.description: The unusual nature of Carlton captain Chris Judd's arm-grab on North Melbourne's Leigh Adams could see it referred straight to the AFL tribunal.

item.title: Crows crush Giants by 119 points
item.description: Adelaide have proven they can kick a big score without key forwards Kurt Tippett and Taylor Walker, demolishing Greater Western Sydney by 119 points.

item.title: Titans eye finals after thumping Raiders
item.description: Gold Coast are within striking distance of the NRL top eight after an impressive 38-26 thumping of Canberra on Sunday.

item.title: Businesses 'under energy cost strain'
item.description: The Australian Industry Group says companies are under pressure from rising energy costs, even though they are improving their energy efficiency.

item.title: Truss appeals to LNP to work against Labor federally
item.description: Nationals leader Warren Truss has told a triumphant LNP party conference that Queensland was fed up with Labor’s mismanagement and that now it was time to spread the sentiment nationally.

item.title: CA chief tells players to adjust to heat
item.description: Cricket Australia chief James Sutherland says players will simply have to adjust to the heat and late-night schedule of the series in Sharjah.

item.title: Cooper to face further SANZAR scrutiny
item.description: Reds five-eighth Quade Cooper's chances of playing in the Super Rugby qualifying final against the Sharks will be decided before a judiciary on Monday.

item.title: Sharing Garden Island sensible: O'Farrell
item.description: NSW Premier Barry O'Farrell says PM Julia Gillard's decision to allow cruise ships to regularly use the Garden Island naval base is a sensible move.
